maml:description.maml:para: Gets configuration information from a file.
Gets configuration information for this module from a file. The results are stored in the global $settings variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an element from a OneNote Page.
Gets an element from a OneNote Page. Returned as an XML element.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Id of the page element.
The page hosting the element. Can be a page metadata object returned by Get-ONPage or an XmlDocument object returned by Get-ONPageXML .
The page hosting the element. Can be a page metadata object returned by Get-ONPage or an XmlDocument object returned by Get-ONPageXML .
The data-id attribute of the element to be retrieved.
The Id of the page element.
The page hosting the element. Can be a page metadata object returned by Get-ONPage or an XmlDocument object returned by Get-ONPageXML .
The data-id attribute of the element to be retrieved.

maml:description.maml:para: You can pipe an XHTML Page resource to this cmdlet, such as the output from Get-ONPageXML , or a page metadata object.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of OneNote NoteBooks.
Gets a list of OneNote NoteBooks matching the supplied filter or at the given URL. If no filter is supplied then all NoteBooks will be returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: An *OData * filter used to determine which NoteBooks are returned.
An *OData * filter used to determine which NoteBooks are returned.

maml:description.maml:para: You cannot pipe to this cmdlet.
A collection of PSCustomObjects representing Graph NoteBook resources.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of OneNote Pages matching the given Filter, or found at the given URL.

Gets a list of OneNote Pages matching the given Filter or found at the given URL. If no filter or URL is provided all Pages in all NoteBooks will be returned. The filter should be valid OData. The information returned is the standard set of Graph metadata for a Page object.

maml:Description.maml:para: The filter to use for the Page list. OData.
The URL from which to retrieve Pages.
The filter to use for the Page list. OData.
The URL from which to retrieve Pages.

maml:description.maml:para: You cannot pipe to this cmdlet.
Collection representing Graph Page resources.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ONPages -Filter "startswith(title,'OneNote')" | Select-Object Id,Title
id title -- ----- 0-1f9aa8a73e9a4f14b4daa7762b5aa530!42-816F7725BEF00A5F!665027 OneNote Class Notebooks 0-634cb14d92da4a1c85ca21fccb057cf7!39-816F7725BEF00A5F!665030 OneNote in Education Resources 0-8d3847e53f7d452aaddc4f63814b8d59!11-816F7725BEF00A5F!1079 OneNote Clipper Installation 0-bf55e9873b624c5c98d779f0e9f6e6d1!21-816F7725BEF00A5F!665031 OneNote and Learning Styles

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a list of Pages found at a specific URL.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the XHTML source of a OneNote Page.
Gets the XHTML source of a OneNote Page. This cmdlet automatically requests element IDs to aid in page updates.

maml:Description.maml:para: A OneNote Page object. Must have a 'contentURL' property.
A switch parameter, that if supplied, tells the cmdlet to output the page content a text, rather than an XMLDocument object.
A OneNote Page object. Must have a 'contentURL' property.
A switch parameter, that if supplied, tells the cmdlet to output the page content a text, rather than an XMLDocument object.

maml:description.maml:para: Representing a Page resource. Must have a 'contentURL' property.
XHTML document object

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ONPage -uri ' https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/me/onenote/pages/0-bf55e9873b624c5c98d779f0e9f6e6d1!51-816F7725BEF00A5F!665031' | Get-ONPageXML | Select-Object -Expand OuterXml ePortfolio

OneNote makes it easy to track student progress in one notebook. You can easily track items like homework, quizzes, and tests for all your students. Some teachers create a notebook for each student in the class. Then they can put homework, quizzes, tests and even a copies of a group project into this ePortfolio.


For quizzes and tests, you can track the items that students either get consistently wrong or consistently correct. You can even keep copies of the student's completed quizzes or tests in case you want to refer to them later.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command pipes a Page object to Get-ONPageXML . Expanding the 'html' property displays the full XHTML of the page.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$page = Get-ONPage -uri ' https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/me/onenote/pages/0-bf55e9873b624c5c98d779f0e9f6e6d1!51-816F7725BEF00A5F!665031' | Get-ONPageXML $page.GetElementsByTagName('p')
id style #text -- ----- ----- p:{ebb53e77-c34a-4a11-ad64-7c7fff9d7562}{34} margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt {OneNote makes it easy to , in one notebook. You can easily track items like , , , , and ...} p:{ebb53e77-c34a-4a11-ad64-7c7fff9d7562}{35} margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt For quizzes and tests, you can track the items that students either get consistently wrong or consistently correct. You can eve...

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command pipes a Page object to Get-ONPageXML and stores the result in the variable $page. $page can then be accessed as an XMLDocument object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ONPage -uri ' https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/me/onenote/pages/0-bf55e9873b624c5c98d779f0e9f6e6d1!51-816F7725BEF00A5F!665031' | Get-ONPageXML -AsText ePortfolio

OneNote makes it easy to track student progress in one notebook. You can easily track items like homework, quizzes, and tests for all your students. Some teachers create a notebook for each student in the class. Then they can put homework, quizzes, tests and even a copies of a group project into this ePortfolio.


For quizzes and tests, you can track the items that students either get consistently wrong or consistently correct. You can even keep copies of the student's completed quizzes or tests in case you want to refer to them later.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command pipes a page object to Get-ONPageXML . The -AsText switch means that the output is a string rather than an XML document.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of OneNote Section Groups matching the supplied filter.

Gets a list of OneNote Section Groups matching the supplied filter, or at the supplied URL. If no filter is supplied, all SectionGroups in all NoteBooks will be returned. The filter must be vaild OData.

maml:Description.maml:para: The filter to be used. Must be valid OData
The URL from which to retrieve SectionGroups.
The filter to be used. Must be valid OData
The URL from which to retrieve SectionGroups.

maml:description.maml:para: You cannot pipe to this cmdlet.
Collection of PSCustomObjects representing Graph SectionGroup Resources.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ONSectiongroups -Filter "displayname eq 'Work'"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of OneNote Sections matching the supplied filter, or at the supplied URL. If no filter or URL is supplied then all Sections in all NoteBooks will be returned.
Gets a list of OneNote Sections matching the supplied filter. If no filter is supplied then all Sections are returned. The filter must be valid OData syntax.

maml:Description.maml:para: The filter to be used. OData.
The URL from which to retieve Sections.
The filter to be used. OData.
The URL from which to retieve Sections.

maml:description.maml:para: Collection of PSCustomObjects representing Graph Section resources.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ONSections "displayname eq 'Other Education Examples'"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a set of useful variable values.
Gets some variable values. Useful in monitoring/debugging.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-ONSessionVariables

maml:description.maml:para: Converts a Table from a OneNote Page into a PSCustomObject array
Converts a Table from a OneNote Page into a PSCustomObject array. This would then be suitable for export to another format.

maml:Description.maml:para: An XML representation of a table as returned by Get-ONElement.
Identifies that the table does not contain a first row of column headings. The columns will be named Column 1 .. Column n as required.
Identifies that the table does not contain a first row of column headings. The columns will be named Column 1 .. Column n as required.
An XML representation of a table as returned by Get-ONElement.

maml:description.maml:para: Representing an HTML table as XML.
Representation of the table as a PSCustomObject array.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ONPages -Filter "title eq 'Data Page'" | Get-ONElement -DataId 'myTable' | Get-ONTableAsObject
Alpha Bravo Charlie ----- ----- ------- One Two Three Four Five Six ... ... ...

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves an XML table with the data id 'myTable' using Get-ONElement and converts it into a PSCustomobject array

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-ONPages -Filter "title eq 'Data Page'" | Get-ONElement -DataId 'myTable' | Get-ONTableAsObject | Export-CSV -Path .\myTable.csv -NoTypeInformation PS C:\> Get-Content .\myTable.csv "Alpha","Bravo","Charlie" "One","Two","Three" "Four","Five","Six" " "," "," "

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves an XML table with the data id 'myTable' using Get-ONElement and converts it into a PSCustomobject array and exports it to a CSV file using Export-CSV .

maml:description.maml:para: Checks for presence of Auth Code and Access Token.
If not present or expired then requests new.
This function maintains a valid set of Graph credentials, comprising an Authorization Code and an Access Token.
TYpically this function is called before any access is attempted to the Graph API itself.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-ONTokenStatus

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes the default handler for onenote: URLs and loads a page.
Invokes the default application for handling 'onenote:' URLs and passes it the URL of a page to load, based on an ID or a Page object.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the page to be loaded.
A Page object to be loaded.
The ID of the page to be loaded.
A Page object to be loaded.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-ONApp -Page (Get-ONPages -Filter "title eq '2 - Life Cycle of Tree Frog'")

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses Get-ONPages to obtain a Page object matching the filter, and this is passed to Invoke-ONApp

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-ONApp -ID ' 0-634cb14d92da4a1c85ca21fccb057cf7!40-816F7725BEF00A5F!665030'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command opens a Page based on its ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Invokes the default web browser application and loads a page.
Invokes the default application for handling web pages and passes it the URL of a page to load, based on an ID or a Page object.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the Page to be loaded.
A Page object to be loaded.
The ID of the Page to be loaded.
A Page object to be loaded.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-ONWeb -Page (Get-ONPages -Filter "title eq '2 - Life Cycle of Tree Frog'")

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses Get-ONPages to obtain a Page object matching the filter, and this is passed to Invoke-ONWeb

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-ONWeb -ID ' 0-634cb14d92da4a1c85ca21fccb057cf7!40-816F7725BEF00A5F!665030'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command opens a Page based on its ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new OneNote page element.

Creates a new OneNote page element. This cmdlet can be used to create elements for new Pages generated by New-ONPageXML . If no document object is supplied then a temporary System.XML.XMLDocument object is created.

maml:Description.maml:para: The type of element to create. Possible values:
- head
- body
- title
- meta
- p
- ul
- ol
- li
- pre
- b
- i
- table
- tr
- td
- div
- span
- img
- br
- cite
The document object in which to create the new element.
The type of element to create. Possible values:
- head
- body
- title
- meta
- p
- ul
- ol
- li
- pre
- b
- i
- table
- tr
- td
- div
- span
- img
- br
- cite
The document object in which to create the new element.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $div = New-ONElement -Type div PS C:\> $div.InnerText = "Hello" PS C:\> $div.OuterXML
Hello

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example a div element is created and its text value set. Note that a 'lang' attribute has been added.

maml:description.maml:para: Saves the settings object to an XML file.
Saves the settings object to an XML file, allowing storage of information not suitable for embedding in a script or module.

maml:Description.maml:para: Defines the path to save the settings file to. Defaults to:
$HOME\.config\OneNoteUtilities.config
Switch parameter to allow overwriting an existing file.
Switch parameter to allow overwriting an existing file.
Defines the path to save the settings file to. Defaults to:
$HOME\.config\OneNoteUtilities.config

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Save-ONConfig -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command saves the current configuration to the default location, overwriting the existing file, if it exists.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the page indentation level of a OneNote Page.
Sets the page indentation level of a OneNote Page. Not applicable to the first Page in a Section.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Id of the OneNote Page.
The level for the page. Possible values:
The Id of the OneNote Page.
The level for the page. Possible values:

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-ONPageLevel -ID '0-b9b9988092b24ac0bb14d4953f88ca2f!61-816F7725BEF00A5F!731583' -Level 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command indents the PageLevel of the given Page to level 1. This will only succeed if the Page is not the first one in the Section.

maml:description.maml:para: A Test suite that will excercise the capabilities of the module. Tied to the structure of the Author's NoteBooks :(
A Test suite that will excercise the capabilities of the module. Tied to the structure of the Author's NoteBooks :( . Running with the -Verbose switch provides diagnostic information.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Test-ONUtilities

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a specified element on a OneNote Page.
Updates a specified element on a OneNote Page, identified by its ID.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the page to be modified.
The ID of the Page element to be updated, or the 'body' or 'title' keyword.
The action to be undertaked. Possible values: replace, append, delete, insert, or prepend
The XHTML content for the Action.
The location of the content in relation to the target. Possible values: after (default) or before
The ID of the page to be modified.
The action to be undertaked. Possible values: replace, append, delete, insert, or prepend
The XHTML content for the Action.
The location of the content in relation to the target. Possible values: after (default) or before
The ID of the Page element to be updated, or the 'body' or 'title' keyword.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$page = Get-ONPages -Filter "title eq 'Project Zero Work List'" | Get-ONPageXML $page.OuterXML Project Zero Work List

Implementation needs to be completed by 1st July 2019

Update-ONElement -TargetID 'p:{5071e2d9-b596-0397-0473-9e65c6a6ede6}{31}' -Id 0-3f5159c19028036127617e60b3e94771!1-816F7725BEF00A5F!1079 -action replace -content '

Implementation needs to be completed by 1st December 2019

' $page = Get-ONPages -Filter "title eq 'Project Zero Work List'" | Get-ONPageXML $page.OuterXML Project Zero Work List

Implementation needs to be completed by 1st December 2019

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example we first retrieve the XML content of a page using Get-ONPages and Get-ONPageXML, then we update the content of a paragraph element. We then re-retrieve the page to check that the content has changed. Note that the Id of the paragraph is changed because we are replacing it.
